title: Add required generated PNG assets (exact filenames) and enforce dimension validation in build verification

acceptanceCriteria: Each listed filename exists as a real file under `frontend/public/generated/` with the exact casing and spelling.
Each listed image has the exact pixel dimensions specified in its filename (e.g., `...dim_800x600...` is exactly 800×600 px).
After `vite build`, each listed file exists under `frontend/dist/generated/` with the exact same filename.
At runtime, requesting `/generated/<filename>` returns HTTP 200 for each listed filename.

requirements.text: Update `frontend/vite-build-verify.js` to validate the pixel dimensions (width×height) of the required generated PNG files in addition to verifying presence, and fail the script with a clear English error message if any required file is missing or has incorrect dimensions.

quotes: is this correct are they the right sizes ?

acceptanceCriteria: Running `node frontend/vite-build-verify.js` fails if any required file is missing from `frontend/public/generated` or `frontend/dist/generated`.
Running `node frontend/vite-build-verify.js` fails if any required file exists but its actual pixel dimensions do not match the `dim_WIDTHxHEIGHT` part of its filename.
Failure output is in English and identifies (a) the filename and (b) expected vs actual dimensions.
Script continues to pass when all required files exist and all dimensions match.

constraints: Use the exact filenames provided by the user (case-sensitive; no renames or substitutions).
All user-facing text included in logs/errors and any UI changes must be in English.

Do not modify any files under immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., `frontend/src/components/ui`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x)`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`).
Static image assets must be served from the frontend as build artifacts (i.e., present under `frontend/public/generated/` so Vite publishes them to `frontend/dist/generated/`).
nonGoals: Adding new backend functionality or modifying Motoko canister logic.
Changing existing asset URL conventions away from `/generated/...`.
Implementing new product features beyond restoring/validating these static assets.
